required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Camrelizumab Combined With Apatinib for Advanced Gastric or Esophagogastric Adenocarcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: Camrelizumab Combined With Apatinib for Advanced Gastric or Esophagogastric Adenocarcinoma Progressed After Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors:a Single-arm,Open-label Prospective Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a phase II study, to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of Camrelizumab combined with apatinib for advanced gastric or esophagogastric adenocarcinoma progressed after immune checkpoint inhibitors.

primary_outcome.description: ORR was defined as the percentage of participants with best overall response of either CR or PR

secondary_outcome.description: PFS was defined as the time from the first day of treatment to the first documented disease progression per RECIST 1.1 based on investigator assessment, or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.
OS was defined as the first day of treatment to death due to any cause.
DCR was defined as the percentage of participants with best overall response of either CR or PR or SD
TTP was defined as the time from the first day of treatment to the first documented disease progression per RECIST 1.1 based on investigator assessment in All Participants.
DOR was defined as the time from first documented evidence of CR or PR until disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first.

intervention.description: 200 mg intravenous (IV) camrelizumab on Day 1 and Day 15 of each 28-day cycle.

facility.name: Henan cancer hospital/The affiliated Cancer Hospital of ZhengZhou university
